title: Dua Lipa loved this North End restaurant so much she went there twice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Dua Lipa visited Neptune Oyster twice for lobster rolls during her Boston tour stop.
She also enjoyed martinis at The Red Fox restaurant, owned by All Day Hospitality Group.
Lipa performed at TD Garden on September 9 and 10 as part of her 'Radical Optimism' tour.

title: 2025 Emmys predictions: Who will win, who will get snubbed
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: The 2025 Emmys are set for Sunday at 8 p.m., airing on CBS and streaming on Paramount+.
Predicted major winners include “Severance,” “Adolescence,” and “The Studio” in key award categories.
Notable expected snubs are "Andor" for Best Drama and Britt Lower for Best Actress in a Drama.

title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises younger Red Sox players to stay calm and keep things simple as they push for playoffs.
Boston Red Sox hold the second AL wildcard spot with a 81-68 record, facing crucial final 13 games.
Bregman hit his first home run since August in a loss against the Yankees, highlighting his importance for postseason push.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution tied 1-1 with Toronto FC at Gillette Stadium, avoiding a home loss with a 90th-minute equalizer.
Revolution's playoff hopes remain technically alive due to Chicago's loss, but realistically dim with ongoing performance issues.
Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start, impressing with steady play; Coach Caleb Porter praises young players' development.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Cora advises Red Sox to focus on current games rather than planning for playoffs despite strong positioning.
Red Sox hold the second wild card in AL, trailing Yankees by 1.5 games; Rangers trail by 3 games.
Boston has a 90%+ playoff probability but faces a tough schedule compared to the chasing Texas Rangers.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow is prioritizing hiring a new general manager for the Red Sox this offseason, reports indicate.
The general manager position has been vacant since Breslow became the chief baseball officer in 2024.
Assistant general managers Ferreira, Romero, Groopman, Smith, and Toboni are potential candidates for the role.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints, receiving a 2027 sixth-round pick and giving a 2028 seventh-round pick.
Polk, a 2024 second-round pick, had 12 receptions for 87 yards and two touchdowns in his rookie season.
Polk was placed on injured reserve for 2025 after a preseason shoulder injury, ending his season early.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots aim to end their five-game losing streak against the Dolphins in Miami in Week 2.
Dolphins QB Tua Tagovailoa holds a 7-0 record against the Patriots since being drafted in 2020.
Tyreek Hill's performance has declined, lacking a 30-yard catch since the 2024 season opener.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed a Southern Gothic-inspired concert at Boston's Roadrunner on September 12, 2025.
Cain's setlist included songs from her albums 'Preacher's Daughter' and 'Willoughby Tucker, I'll Always Love You'.
The performance featured themed stage design and a guest appearance by Jae Matthews from Boy Harsher.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior,' a film about a 59-year-old returning to college football.
The film, directed by Rod Lurie, will have a pre-release screening in Boston on Sept. 14 before its national release.
Chiklis, a former Andover High football player, reconnects with old teammates for the screening event in Boston.
